summary: We know you love Sansa but what do you think of Sophie as an actor or person?
question: We know you love Sansa but what do you think of Sophie as an actor or person?
answer: Sophie really impressed me as an actress, ever since her emotional scenes at the end of the first season. Not only did her performance there caught me off guard, but she absolutely nailed the subtleties linked to Sansa’s character. Through out the second season, she’s in a position where what she says isn’t what she thinks or feels, and yet the show managed to get the whole spectrum of her character conveyed to the watchers through the way Sophie acted out these scenes. There are also big moments that really stood out to me. For example, her acting in Littlefinger’s trial at the Vale was to die for. While I definitely enjoyed Sophie’s acting in later seasons of the show, my favorite scenes of hers were these where the writers gave her more subtleties to work with. Still, moments like Ramsey’s death scene, and Littlefinger’s trial really let Sophie shine as an actress. As a person, I also really like her. I have to admit that my love for a character often transmits itself to an actor/actress, but I find her to be a really likable person. She’s sweet, funny and I love watching her interviews. What I particularly appreciate about her is the fact that she always stood up for Sansa, even way back in season one where everyone else dismissed her. She is emotionally connected to her character to an such a great extent, and it’s really nice to see. A lot of people think that Sophie doesn’t really understand Sansa because she gets giddily at things such as killing Ramsey and Littlefinger’s trial, but while she obviously wants to be challenged as an actress and want people to appreciate this character that she cares so much for, it’s evident that she genuinely loves Sansa when looking at all of the interviews of Sophie in the early part of the show where she gave really accurate descriptions of Sansa’s character, her perspective on life, and what makes her just as strong a character (if not stronger) than the other (more masculine) female characters of the show. I also really love seeing her not afraid to let her opinion on important social and political topics be known to others. While she doesn’t talk about them online every single day, she contributes to the discussions, which I really appreciate. Even after Game Of Thrones is over, I’ll still support this wonderful actress and person.

summary: Don't you think silk scarf that Sansa wears in the trailer can be reference to Catelyn? She wore exactly the same in earlier...
question: Don't you think silk scarf that Sansa wears in the trailer can be reference to Catelyn? She wore exactly the same in earlier seasons. Even in the same bluish color.
answer:
I’m not sure which scarves you mean, anon. I checked a few episodes per season and all the ones I found looked like these:

I don’t think these look like Sansa’s scarf at all. The fabrics are different. Cat’s almost look like an extra collar or the collar of an undershirt. Or, I suppose, it’s just a simply wrapped scarf. Sansa’s is tied, possibly beneath the collar of her dress (which I imagine myself seeing). And while Cat’s is olive green, I’m honestly not sure what color Sansa’s scarf is. I get why people say it’s blue, but I’m not sure whether it’s blue or dark gray because it could just be the tint of the shot. Her furs look blueish too even though they’re supposed to be black/silver/gray.

But that doesn’t mean it’s not inspired by Cat’s scarves. It can be. But, iirc, we’ve seen the type Cat wears on more characters than I can count (and regardless of gender too) so I’m not so sure about that.

It might just be a sign of colder weather, I suppose. Perhaps we’ll see this type of accessory on several characters, just like we did with Cat’s scarf.

Thanks for the ask!

summary: A song of water and fire
title: A song of water and fire
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2TQJZ4g

by LadyPalma

He found her in his bed. Laying on the covers and fully dressed, but still with a sort of expectant look in her eyes. He could not possibly imagine a reason for her to be there, certainly he hadn’t been the one to invite her.

tags: source: one day at a time
summary:
Sansa: I’m going to get groceries
Arya: It’s 7 in the morning
Sansa: I like to beat the traffic
Arya: You’re walking
Sansa: Foot...
body:
Sansa: I’m going to get groceries

Arya: It’s 7 in the morning

Sansa: I like to beat the traffic

Arya: You’re walking

Sansa: Foot traffic *leaves*

Gendry: Must be nice, living with someone who gets the groceries

Arya: Yeah, without her list or purse

Arya: Or leaving *opens door to reveal Sansa eavesdropping*

No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

summary: “As for my own part I care not for death, for all men are mortal; and though I be a woman yet I have as good a courage...
caption:
“As for my own part I care not for death, for all men are mortal; and though I be a woman yet I have as good a courage answerable to my place as ever my father had. I am your anointed Queen.”

- Elizabeth I, Collected Works

summary: anon was right after all. everyone loves dany except sansa, even sam didn't care that his family was murdered. jon learnt about...
body:
anon was right after all. everyone loves dany except sansa, even sam didn’t care that his family was murdered. jon learnt about his parents but all he cares about is that dany is rightful queen. 8 seasons of anticipation supposedly ends with jon riding rhaegal, that’s the sledgehammer kit was referencing apparently. emilia said dany was smug but in friki’s leaks she’s trying to make friends with sansa. no jaime, theon saves yara just like that, euron apparently forces cersei into having sex with him to get access to the sellsword company but we see the captain of the golden company standing in front of cersei in the trailer. 

smh this dumbass. we should have waited until he got actual spoilers because this man really thinks cersei will find out about viserion before castle black is destroyed.

title: Letters
body:
Written for day 7 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt CLOTHES or LETTERS or FOOD

King Jon of Westeros is traveling through the seven kingdoms and while Sansa waits for him to return she writes him letters about their daughter Runa.

post canon // canon compliant // canon divergent

Sansa stared at her daughter, bent over her embroidery work with the tip of her tongue between her slightly parted lips.

Her daughter had Sansa’s piercing blue eyes, focussed on the piece of fabric and the stitches she was trying to perfect. But she had Jon’s dark curls, surrounding her angelic looking face. But her daughter didn’t just have Jon’s hair. She also had inherited his stubbornness, his loyalty and most of all a burning fire in her veins that made her fight for those who couldn’t fight for themselves. In a very unladylike manner.

My beloved Jon,

When this letter reaches you, you’re most likely on your way back to Winterfell, on your way back home. I can’t wait to hold you in my arms again and to share those small moments of wonder with you that I now have to write down so you can still be a part of them. Because with each and every passing day Runa grows up to be everything you had wanted your daughter to be and so much more.

A few days ago I discovered that Runa had fled from her septa again. The poor old lady had been looking everywhere for her. She had barely dared to come to me, afraid that I would be angry, especially if something would have happened to Runa while she was supposed to be under the Septa’s watch. It took me half an hour to explain her that I didn’t expect her to cage a free bird.

Even father never fully tried to cage Arya, something I’m still thankful for until today. If father had not allowed Arya to take those sword fighting lessons to wield needle, our future might not have looked this bright and long. I know that mother would still wonder how we are every going to find a suitable husband for our Runa, but I hope that after the big war, and the roles both Arya and Brienne played in it, our men have learned to value a weapon wielding lady.

We found her in the kitchen. Both her nose and her lip were bleeding and small wounds covered her knuckles, but she didn’t look half as bad as the boy opposing her, who had the length to tower over her, but was on the ground with two black eyes and a few broken bones. And yet our daughter still believed he had not gotten what he deserved.

When I asked Runa what the poor boy had done to deserve her beating, she assured me that she had proof that he had threatened quite a few girls and had stolen kisses and touches from them. And even though I had to teach her that she couldn’t take such matters into her own hands, but had to come to me with them so we could serve justice, I couldn’t be prouder of her either.

I hope that dealing with people like him will be the worst of her problems, now and in the future. Because I’ve seen war and I don’t want my children to live through one. But if another war ever happens to Westeros, I know who will be winning said war, easily. She will make powerful enemies. She will probably lose a few battles here and there. And she will need someone with a sharp mind at her side to keep her from throwing herself recklessly into situations she can’t oversee completely. But she will also inspire loads of people to rally behind her and to give their lives for her and those she loves.

Just like you.

Sansa looked up from her letter when Runa cursed.

The sharp needle had pierced her daughter’s skin and drops of blood were staining the white cloth. Not that there was much to ruin. Runa had never displayed any talent when it came to embroidery. She had never dared to ask to not have to do it anymore either though. Most likely because the customs of Westeros were hard to shake and Runa was afraid to disappoint her parents. As if she ever could.

“Why don’t you put that aside to take Black Wind on a ride?” Sansa smiled. “Your father will be home in two weeks from now. He will certainly want to race the two of you to see if you have improved during the last few months.”

“Will you join us, mother?” Runa stood up from her seat and she put her bleeding finger in her mouth. “I promise not to race away from you.” Runa smiled and Sansa couldn’t help but smiling back at her.

“I want to finish this letter to your father first.” Sansa saw the disappointment on her daughter’s face. “But you can already saddle the horses. I will come down in a few minutes.”

Runa wrapped her arms around her mother and pressed a soft kiss on Sansa’s cheek. “Tell him that I’m counting down the days already.” She hurried out of the room and rushed down the stairs, her footsteps echoing through the castle.

A few minutes later Sansa saw Runa running across the courtyard to the stables. Sansa never liked being without Jon, especially not for so long. But no matter how far apart they were, she cherished the piece of himself that he always left with her.

But for now I want her to stay like this. Carefree. Lighthearted. Innocent. Just like we once were, before King Robert showed up at our doorstep and asked father to be his hand. And even though the future didn’t turn out as bad as I once feared, I wouldn’t be able to go through the pain of seeing her harmed in anyway.

Just like Runa, I am also counting down the days until you are safely back home with us again. No matter how awesome Runa is and no matter how often Bran and Arya visit, Winterfell only feels complete when you are here too.

With all my heart,

Sansa

She read over her words once more while she waited for the ink to dry. She had sent countless of letters during the last few months and she had gotten just as many back. But no letter, no matter how sweet, was as good as being in Jon’s arms and kissing his lips.
body_abstract:
Written for day 7 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt CLOTHES or LETTERS or FOOD

King Jon of Westeros is traveling through the seven kingdoms and while Sansa waits for him to return she writes him letters about their daughter Runa.

post canon // canon compliant // canon divergent

Sansa stared at her daughter, bent over her embroidery work with the tip of her tongue between her slightly parted lips.

Her daughter had Sansa’s piercing blue eyes, focussed on the piece of fabric and the stitches she was trying to perfect. But she had Jon’s dark curls, surrounding her angelic looking face. But her daughter didn’t just have Jon’s hair. She also had inherited his stubbornness, his loyalty and most of all a burning fire in her veins that made her fight for those who couldn’t fight for themselves. In a very unladylike manner.

My beloved Jon,

When this letter reaches you, you’re most likely on your way back to Winterfell, on your way back home. I can’t wait to hold you in my arms again and to share those small moments of wonder with you that I now have to write down so you can still be a part of them. Because with each and every passing day Runa grows up to be everything you had wanted your daughter to be and so much more.

A few days ago I discovered that Runa had fled from her septa again. The poor old lady had been looking everywhere for her. She had barely dared to come to me, afraid that I would be angry, especially if something would have happened to Runa while she was supposed to be under the Septa’s watch. It took me half an hour to explain her that I didn’t expect her to cage a free bird.

Even father never fully tried to cage Arya, something I’m still thankful for until today. If father had not allowed Arya to take those sword fighting lessons to wield needle, our future might not have looked this bright and long. I know that mother would still wonder how we are every going to find a suitable husband for our Runa, but I hope that after the big war, and the roles both Arya and Brienne played in it, our men have learned to value a weapon wielding lady.

We found her in the kitchen. Both her nose and her lip were bleeding and small wounds covered her knuckles, but she didn’t look half as bad as the boy opposing her, who had the length to tower over her, but was on the ground with two black eyes and a few broken bones. And yet our daughter still believed he had not gotten what he deserved.

When I asked Runa what the poor boy had done to deserve her beating, she assured me that she had proof that he had threatened quite a few girls and had stolen kisses and touches from them. And even though I had to teach her that she couldn’t take such matters into her own hands, but had to come to me with them so we could serve justice, I couldn’t be prouder of her either.

blog.name: outoftunemelody
blog.title: Fiction consumes me and reality is a distant dream

summary: When Jonsas said in confidence that Jon was whispering in Sansa's ear to "play along" when in fact Jon is whispering in Arya's...
body:
When Jonsas said in confidence that Jon was whispering in Sansa’s ear to “play along” when in fact Jon is whispering in Arya’s ear to convince Sansa to back him and Daenerys…

I AM LIVING

blog.name: scorpion-flower
blog.title: ...Of Ruins and Red Nightfall
blog.description: But beneath the pale blue petals, the thorns lay hidden...

tags: a song of ice and fire
we were the kings and the queues
summary: I'm sitting here laughing my butt off because some Jon x Daenerys shippers, apparently, seriously believe that Jonsa shippers...
body:
I’m sitting here laughing my butt off because some Jon x Daenerys shippers, apparently, seriously believe that Jonsa shippers hate Arya and consider Gendry the next good thing for Sansa.

Listen, I’m not a big Jonsa shipper although I follow a couple of them, and I have seen nothing but love for Gendrya on those blogs. Like, even in Jonsa fanfics, Genrya is often featured as a secondary pair.

On the contrary, most Jon x Daenerys shippers are the ones who want the sisters to turn against each other so that Arya and Dany can be BFFs…

Gendry x Sansa makes no sense and Jonsa shippers know that. I’m sorry that some Jon x Daenerys shippers let their ship get in the way of seeing things clear and spread false stories about the shippers of couples they don’t like…

P.S. I just read a reply from a Dany stan that was practically about how Sansa stans hate her for burning the Tarlys, because they were shipping Sansa x Dickon. You heard it here first folks! You don’t call Dany out on her bullshit because she is a war criminal and basically no better than Cersei, you call her out on that because shipping!!

You don’t call Dany out on her bullshit because she is a war criminal and basically no better than Cersei, you call her out on that because shipping!!
trail.content:
I’m sitting here laughing my butt off because some Jon x Daenerys shippers, apparently, seriously believe that Jonsa shippers hate Arya and consider Gendry the next good thing for Sansa.

Listen, I’m not a big Jonsa shipper although I follow a couple of them, and I have seen nothing but love for Gendrya on those blogs. Like, even in Jonsa fanfics, Genrya is often featured as a secondary pair.

On the contrary, most Jon x Daenerys shippers are the ones who want the sisters to turn against each other so that Arya and Dany can be BFFs…

Gendry x Sansa makes no sense and Jonsa shippers know that. I’m sorry that some Jon x Daenerys shippers let their ship get in the way of seeing things clear and spread false stories about the shippers of couples they don’t like…

P.S. I just read a reply from a Dany stan that was practically about how Sansa stans hate her for burning the Tarlys, because they were shipping Sansa x Dickon. You heard it here first folks! You don’t call Dany out on her bullshit because she is a war criminal and basically no better than Cersei, you call her out on that because shipping!!

blog.name: hidden-perceptions
blog.title: Welcome Folks
blog.description: You'll find everything on this blog. Movies, tv shows, videogames, comics, anime, manga. Not spoiler free.

body:
Jon and Sansa Leaks

Sansa is overall pissed and annoyed with Jon in the first episode. She’s cold to Dany and it’s obvious that she doesn’t like her. She demands to know if Jon bent the knee for the North’s safety or because he’s in love. Jon is caught off guard by her accusation and doesn’t answer. He later asks Arya to help him with Sansa.

Sansa also has a private conversation with Tyrion where they discuss Cersei.
